thread.title: NFL player's grandmother buried in wrong spot
thread.title_full: NFL player's grandmother buried in wrong spot

title: NFL player's grandmother buried in wrong spot
text:
NFL player's grandmother buried in wrong spot Posted: Updated: The cemetery manager of Dade Memorial Park said the mistake became known when the plot where Lula Mae Hilton was thought to have been buried was purchased by the family of someone else who recently died. (Source: WPLG/CNN) 
MIAMI (WPLG/CNN) - A disturbing mix up at a cemetery caused pain for the family of Indianapolis Colts player T.Y. Hilton. 
Apparently, the NFL player's grandmother was buried in the wrong grave. 
The star receiver and other family members were there Thursday when crews disinterred the casket of Lula Mae Hilton. 
The cemetery manager of Dade Memorial Park said the mistake became known when the plot where Lula Mae Hilton was thought to have been buried was purchased by the family of someone else who recently died. 
Apparently Hilton's grandmother had been buried in an unmarked plot to the right of her burial marker. 
"I was just talking, making believe, talking to someone that don't even exists in that spot," T.Y. Hilton Sr. said. "That's the hurting part." 
"She's the one that spoiled everybody," granddaughter Corteona Hilton said. "She was the one that gave the candy when mommy and daddy said no. It was tough watching it all over again." 
As tough as it was for the family to learn of the mix up, T.Y. Hilton says he's glad the truth came to light. 
The cemetery blamed the mistake on the previous owners. 
The cemetery manager of Dade Memorial Park said the mistake became known when the plot where Lula Mae Hilton was thought to have been buried was purchased by the family of someone else who recently died.
